name: Master System III
coprocessor: Texas Instruments TMS9928A VDP (NTSC)Texas Instruments TMS9929A VDP (PAL)
sound: Texas Instruments SN76489 DCSG, 4 channel mono (3 tone channels, 1 white noise channel)
description:
The Master System III was released in 2003 by Brazilian toy manufacturer Tec Toy. It is exclusive to the Brazilian market where it is still a popular system. Externally the console is the same as the Master System II apart from the colour, which is a very light grey instead of being dark grey.

In fact the Master System III is still on sale to this day. The current version, Master System 3 - 120 Super Jogos Na Mem?ria, comes with 120 games built in.

<br><font color="red"><strong>> US ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote>This guy has so much power in his hands that he has attracted two girls (so far) in his swimming-pool ! <br><br> Notice the classical symbol of the 80s adverts : the glass of orange juice with a straw...</blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> ADVERT (OCTOBER 1982)</strong></font><br><blockquote>"Goupil plays on all tables"</blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> CHARLIE CHAPLIN #3 </strong></font><br><blockquote>1983 - Before the IBM PC became THE universal standard, IBM was looking for good programs using all the features IBM Basic could offer.<br><br> Advert said:<br><br><font color="#666666"> Let your imagination take wing.<br> Think charts, Graphs, Shapes, Images.<br> Use originality, creativity and color in programs that entertain, educate, organize, analyse. And programs that get down to business...<br> ...In fact, if you are interested in licensing your software, we could be interested in publishing it...</font>    </blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> PREVIOUS SYSTEM</strong></font><br><blockquote>Before manufacturing the MPC, Columbia tried to sell a massive multi-user, Z80 based system.</blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> U.K. AD. (AUG. 1986)</strong></font><br><blockquote>Advert says: <br><br><font color="#666666"> In other words, how to pop your office into a shoulder bag and then go out and about.<br> You see the Sharp PC7000 is no ordinary computer. Not only it is light, compact body packed with a much speed and power as most desk top computers, it's also very, very versatile... </font></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> UK ADVERT, OCT 1983</strong></font><br><blockquote>Last sales in the UK. At the same time, a Commodore VIC-20 cost £139 and a Commodore 64 cost $229</blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> COMPUTER NOTES</strong></font><br><blockquote>This fanzine - one of the first of the microcomputers era - was published by the Altair User Group<p class="petitgris">Thanks to <b>Mark Thompson</b> </p></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> UK ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote><p class="petitgris">Thanks to Karl-Heinz  -  http://www.sharpmz.org</p></blockquote>
